alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:57PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Johnson, northwestern Floyd and northeastern Magoffin Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1257 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stringtown, or over Salyersville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Conley and Marshallville around 105 PM EDT. Ballot, Ivyton and Oil Springs around 110 PM EDT. Swamp Branch, Dobson and Riceville around 115 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Leander, Patrick, Denver, Fitz, Bonanza, Brainard, Dotson, Paintsville, Collista and Hagerhill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern and northeastern Kentucky.
